intro: Dicalix modesta, commonly known as the modest dicalix, is a species of flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many economically important plants such as coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. It typically grows in shaded, moist environments within forest understories. Dicalix modesta is not widely cultivated but is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological role.
